findings.title: Missing validations for unlock timeline that can make an address locked forever
findings.description: The contract does not have any validations for `unlockTime` when adding a new locking schedule for an address in the `addScheduleLockByAddress` function, which can cause the remaining locked balance to be locked forever.

findings.title: Address parameters of events should be indexed
findings.description: The `Unlock` and `AddAddressLock` events should have `indexed` keywords for `addressLock` parameters to facilitate filtering events related to a specific address easily.

findings.title: Hard-coded token name and symbol in super contract LockCoin
findings.description: Name and symbol of Roseon token should be specified in the derived contract (RoseonToken) instead of hard-coded in the super contract (LockCoin).

findings.title: Missing error messages when using require function
findings.description: The `transfer` and `transferFrom` functions inside the `RoseonToken` contract are using `require` function without an error message.

findings.title: Unnecessary use of SafeMath library
findings.description: The compiler has built-in overflow checking starting from Solidity version 0.8.0, making the Openzeppelin's SafeMath library unnecessary.
